Advice.heading: Getting more speed for your money
Advice.content: Different application simply demand for different computer builds. It is not as simple as choose a bigger CPU and more RAM for a bigger app such as Video Editing. You also need to consider other components, such as Disk RAIDS or GPUs. A computer architect expert knows how to balance the performance of all computer parts to give you the best speed for your money. This is exactly the value of ViCase with its V²Configurator. Our team of experts and community members has developed 30+ Configurations exactly customized for your Use Case. Something an Off The Shelf Standard PC just can not deliver.

Advice.heading: Create a full custom build with just two mouse clicks
Advice.content: You configure your PC in the left Pane "Configuration": 1) Choose your Field of Application 2) Choose your Use Case. || In Preview you can inspect how your custom build looks like

Advice.heading: Straight forward check out
Advice.content: Under the "Summary" Pane to the right side you find two check out buttons: "Checkout Village" and "Checkout 3rd Party". When pressed you see your basket. Each item is shown with a link. Pressing it brings you to the respective item in the corresponding online shop. Our items are Perks in our Indiegogo Campaign, giving you extra saving over what they will cost in our online shop.

Advice.heading: Buy 3rd party items in the shop of your choice
Advice.content: You can of course use the links to the items in Amazon and Newegg as a reference and find the same parts in your favorite shop.

Advice.heading: Tune your Custom Build
Advice.content: In case you want to dig in and maybe choose a faster CPU, more memory, bigger disks etc, you can easily do that by unfolding the corresponding chapters. For every part you can find comparison tables, advice, gallery images and links to more information right at your finger tips. Saving you a lot of time searching the internet to find answers.

Advice.heading: Who is the ViCase Gaming PC for
Advice.content: You are a technically interested person or you know someone to help you. You want a small, beautiful and powerful custom build PC with the key Field of Application being Gaming. Since ViCase PC is a standard PC you can of course do all other things with it. That being said, all parts have been chosen to deliver the best gaming experience for your money. You do not need to have DIY Custom PC experience. The V²Configurator will create an optimized configuration for you that works. When your PC arrives in parts, you will follow our instruction Videos on how to assemble your ViCase PC. If you can use a screw driver and follow instructions in a video you will be fine and reward yourself with a Gaming Rig that is beautiful, powerful, upgradeable and may have features important for you that you can not find elsewhere.

Advice.heading: ViCase Gaming PC versus Gaming Console
Advice.content: Gaming Consoles are great for non technical people to bring the gaming fun into the living room. They are easy to set up, easy to use, small build and beautiful design to not upset the living room atmosphere. But they are also a closed system. In case you are (or becoming) a technical person you may be already hitting against these limitations. This is where the ViCase Gaming PC comes in. It takes the small size and beautiful looks of the Gaming Consoles, but it is an open system, inviting you to expand it in any direction you please. Once you get your ViCase Gaming PC to work, you will be rewarded with significantly better gaming graphics and higher FPS.

Advice.heading: ViCase Gaming PC versus Gaming Desktop PC
Advice.content: Custom Build Game PCs are the holy grail of Gaming. They deliver the most amazing Gaming Graphics and thus the most immersive experience. But they are big and you need to be a geek to configure and assemble it. This is where ViCase Gaming PC comes in. You can build a full Gaming PC with power GPU Add In Card in a very small case. And the V²Configurator makes configuration a two mouse click affair: Choose Gaming in Field of Application and then pick the most expensive ViCase Gaming PC you can afford :-)

Advice.heading: ViCase Open Custom PC versus Closed Systems
Advice.content: A closed system will be: 1) Easy to install and set up. 2) Maybe lower cost 3) Limited for high end gaming 4) Not much upgradeable if at all. || The ViCase Custom Gaming PC will be: 1) relatively easy to install and set up 2) Maybe higher cost 3) No limit to high end gaming 4) As upgradeable as can be.

Advice.heading: All-In-One Gaming PC
Advice.content: One of the things that set the ViCase Gaming PC apart from other Custom Gaming PCs is its ability that you can convert it into an All-In-One PC. We have three different methods, each with different features and cost, that go even beyond what you would expect from a typical All-In-One. For more information explore the "3. All-In-One Converter" Chapter in the V²Configurator.

Advice.heading: All-In-One Gaming PC with Carry Grip
Advice.content: Gaming is so much more fun when the experience is shared with your friends. This is why LAN Parties are so much fun. With ViCase you can build an All-In-One that has a carry grip and even a shelf to hold your keyboard. Just place ViCase All-In-One on a table, plug in power, power it on, take the keyboard out of the shelf and you are ready to kill. And since this is so easy, you can even carry your Game PC to another room if this is where your friends and family are.

Advice.heading: Ubuntu, Windows 10, Steam OS or all
Advice.content: 1) Ubuntu is very stable and as much fun to use as Windows 10. But its GPU driver support is not as good. Depending on the game you are playing you may experience same speed or it may be noticeably slower. If you play on Ubuntu, you would buy your games on Steam. The biggest draw back is that not all game titles are available on Linux. 2) Windows 10 is the save choice. All titles available and best GPU drivers. Only drawback is that it will set you back $100 US. So you always can start with Ubuntu, invest the $100 into 3 games that play on it and upgrade to Windows 10 later. 3) SteamOS will be a game changer. Pun intended. One day in the future GPUs under SteamOS will have same FPS than under Windows. And all Titles will be available under SteamOS too. Today - however - SteamOS is in beta. It has one thing going for it that is the support of its cool game pad. 4) You can of course install more than one OS and enjoy the different strengths of each.

Advice.heading: Typical Upgrades
Advice.content: 1) More Memory, 2) Faster CPU 3) Faster / Bigger Disk 4) Bigger / Better Case. For any of these unfold the corresponding Chapter and Section below in the Configurator and adjust to your liking.

Advice.heading: Windows 10 Upgrade
Advice.content: We chose Ubuntu on the cost sensitive configurations. It shaves off $100 US which you may prefer to invest into 3 ... 5 Game titles on Steam that do run on Ubuntu. If after some time you itch for this big game that is only available on Windows 10, than it maybe time for an upgrade. Good thing is that you can add to your ViCase Gaming PC whenever extra cash comes in :-)

Advice.heading: Who is the ViCase Home Theater PC for
Advice.content: You are a technically interested person or you know someone to help you. You want a small, beautiful, powerful and extremely quiet custom build PC with the key Field of Application being Home Theater PC. Since ViCase PC is a standard PC you can of course do all other things with it. That being said, all parts have been chosen to deliver the best Home Theater and Fun experience for your money, with the special option to include a full Game PC and Server. You do not need to have DIY Custom PC experience. The V²Configurator will create an optimized configuration for you that works. When your PC arrives in parts, you will follow our instruction Videos on how to assemble your ViCase PC. If you can use a screw driver and follow instructions in a video you will be fine and reward yourself with a Home Theater PC that is beautiful, powerful, upgradeable and may have features important to you that you can not find elsewhere.

Advice.heading: Quiet, Small, Beautiful
Advice.content: All ViCase Home Theater PCs are designed with great care to be whisper quiet. No hum or buzzing will distract you when you listen to your music or watch a movie. The beautiful and small design matches your living room atmosphere.

Advice.heading: Fast & Full PC Advantage
Advice.content: All models are full PCs, fast CPU, fast RAM, fast Boot SSD. Some models have very large and high quality Data Disks and a descent Game GPU card. The performance is very different from a stripped down Home Theater PC appliance. You get a full custom build PC of high quality that you can expand or upgrade in every which way and whenever you want to. This is particular useful since technologies for the Home Theater PC are still emerging, just look at SteamOS beta to mention only one. Now you easily can stay up to date.

Advice.heading: Full All-In-One Package
Advice.content: All Home Theater PCs (except for Tiny HT) come with full All-In-One package. Make your PC disappear completely, yet at the same time have full access to its ports, controls and optical drive. Check out the Gallery, Comparison Table and the All-In-One Conversion Chapter for more details.

Advice.heading: Integrated Server Model
Advice.content: The models Server and Ultimate Fun come with big Storage integrated in the form of 3.5" Hard Disk(s). This means you do not need to set up an additional server. The suggested 3TB is plenty of space for your music, movie collection and your own family photos and movies. You can expand to up to 12 TB.

Advice.heading: Integrated Game PC Model
Advice.content: Game PC quality and frame rates in your living room. The i3 or i5 + GTX 750Ti is a dramatic step up to game consoles. Yet ViCase gives you the small size, nice design and low noise.

Advice.heading: Stand Alone Fun PC
Advice.content: Home Theater PC, Server and Custom Build Game PC All-In-One tiny ViCase.

Advice.heading: Ubuntu or Windows
Advice.content: Ubuntu and Windows 10 are both fun to use and up to the task. Ubuntu is free of cost. Windows 10 is recommended if you want to play the heavy shooter PC Games. For more advice, check out the "OS" Section in the Chapter "Accessories".

Advice.heading: Backup your Family Life
Advice.content: If you do not have a Backup Solution yet, check out "Backup Drive" and "NAS Server" in the Chapter "Accessories". There are options for save, affordable and easy to implement backups or the luxury all automated one.

Advice.heading: Mini
Advice.content: Choose Mini when you are looking for the lowest cost solution, or you simply like how ViCase looks and you do not want to hide it. Since it is very small it does not take much of your desk and all controls and I/O Ports are conveniently available.

Advice.heading: All-In-One
Advice.content: Choose All-In-One if you want the looks and feel of an All-In-One PC. This is how it works: This configuration gives you ViCase-Stand. You mount your Display with VESA mount to it at the front. In the rear you mount your ViCase. In addition you connect ViCase Access to your ViCase and place it beside your Display foot. Now you have hidden your PC, yet you have convenient access to its controls, status LEDs and USB ports. You even get two features that a regular All-In-One PC does not have: 1) you can place your keyboard in the stand to make more space on your desk 2) you get a carry grip when bringing your All-In-One to a LAN party, class, balcony, etc ... || Please note that there might be a lower cost solution for your Display. You can explore it in the V²Configurator►All-In-One Converter►ViCase All-In-One. This option is called ViCase-VESA and it is only $3.

Advice.heading: Mini-Behind-Display
Advice.content: Choose Mini-Behind-Display if you want the looks and feel of an All-In-One PC, but your Display has no VESA mount. It works very simple: ViCase-Feet make your ViCase standing up so it fits behind your Display placed out of sight. Connect the included ViCase Access to to your ViCase and place it beside your Display foot. Now you have hidden your PC, yet you have convenient access to its controls, status LEDs and USB ports.

yourChoice.name: 1-Display
yourChoice.tag: The default choice

yourChoice.name: 2-Displays
yourChoice.tag: Nothing increases your productivity more than working with 2 Displays

yourChoice.name: 3-Displays
yourChoice.tag: Surround gaming on 3 displays is a lot of fun. Working on a High End work station like Trading, CAD or Software Development is more productive with 3 Displays.

Advice.heading: One Display is low cost but may not be most productive
Advice.content: For a long time one display was the default configuration for a computer. In many cases this is however no longer the most efficient configuration. The cost of adding another 22" Display is now $70 US only. For work this gives you one display for research and reference and another display to work. More space will make your more productive. It is the same as if you need to work on a tiny table or you get a big one. More space is more productive.

Advice.heading: When to choose one 4K Display over two middle sized
Advice.content: 4K Displays still come at a significant premium. But in case you work on Photo Editing or 4K Video Editing, they are worth every penny. By seeing much more details of your Photos / Videos you can work faster yet still ensures that your focus is spot on without the time consuming zoom in and out.

Advice.heading: When to choose two or more Middle sized over one big 4K Display
Advice.content: For most scenarios you simply need more space to be more productive or have more fun. As such two 22" Displays may still be significantly cheaper than one 28" 4k display, yet offer you more space. As such they are the more economic and productive choice. Heck for the same money you may even get three 22" Displays, have even more space and when it is time to have you can enjoy Surround gaming on 3 Displays

Advice.heading: When to choose On-board Graphics and when a GPU card
Advice.content: In general for work the on-board graphics will be fast enough. If you do Video Editing then go with an i3 and its integrated GPU will be up to the task, unless you use Adobe Premiere or you edit 4K. In such cases go with a GPU. Please check out the Accessories of the V²Configurator. They contain a good selection of Workstation and Game GPUs.

Advice.heading: Pause and continue my configuration session
Advice.content: Say you worked on your configuration and you want to continue at another time. Just save your work by pressing the "Save My Config" Button and follow its simple instructions. When you are ready to continue press the "Load My Config" Button, follow its instructions and you can continue your configuration where you left off.

Advice.heading: Sharing your configuration to get feedback
Advice.content: If you are the type who asks friends for advice or post questions in forums or simply ask us in comments on our Indiegogo Campaign, then this feature is for you. The V²Configurator makes it very simple to share your config: 1. Press the "Save My Config" Button, 2. Press the "Copy My Config to Clipboard" Button, 3. Paste your config into your post. This is how a configuration could look like:["#ID-81","#ID-2","#ID-5","#ID-15","#ID-9", "#ID-12","#ID-20","#ID-25","#ID-26","#ID-30", "#ID-38","#ID-42","#ID-68"]

Advice.heading: ViCase-Tiny: When space is premium
Advice.content: Choose this Vicase only when space is at an absolute premium. Examples would be wall-mount presentation screens where you mount ViCase-Tiny between display and wall or under the screen. If you plan to place your ViCase behind your display, consider ViCase-Mini. It is taller, but you would not be able to see that anyways.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Mini: The default choice
Advice.content: This is the standard housing that gets most jobs done. With 5L it is still mini in size, yet offers lots of upgradeability options, such as support for up to i7 quad core, Low Profile PCIe Cards (including GTX 750 Ti) and 3 x 2.5" disk in RAID 5. More than enough for most use cases.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Mini-Value: Best value
Advice.content: Exact same housing, except all inside housing parts are made of strong black plastic. The top cover remains CNC cut, sandblasted and anodized aluminum. After ViCase-Mini-Value is assembled, it is virtually indistinguishable from ViCase-Mini.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Ultra: The powerhouse
Advice.content: For the ultimate performance ViCase-Ultra offers all of ViCase-Mini with the but with more space for 3.5" Disks. This is ideal if you need a power workstation with RAID 5 and disk capacity > 6 TB or if you want to build a powerful but quiet and small Server. With only 7 Liters in size ViCase-Ultra can still be mounted behind your Display.

TableBody.title: Max Power TDP w/o Thermal Cycling

Advice.heading: ViCase-Cooler-XS
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Cooler-XS to build a passively cooled Mini PC. This option is not available for Intel CPUs, but only for the AMD Entry Level CPUs. Ideal for PCs that need to run maintenance free for many years. Compatible with all ViCase.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Cooler-S
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Cooler-S to build a Mini PC using the Tiny housing with AMD Entry CPU. More cooling power than the passive cooler. As with all fan based CPU cooler, fan noise will increase with fan speed. Same for your cleaning intervals. You can set ViCase-Cooler-S to be inaudible for normal operation.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Cooler-M
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Cooler-M if you want to use an Intel CPU in ViCase Tiny. Two heat-pipes manage to cool even an Intel i7 Dual Core up to 55W TDP with thermal cycling.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Cooler-L
Advice.content: This is the default choice for ViCase-Mini. Very low cost combined with high cooling power and very low noise. This cooler is also most easy to clean. This cooler only needs 1200 RPM to cool an i3 under constant full load and is practically inaudible. Cools up to 65W TDP without thermal cycling.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Cooler-XL
Advice.content: This is the most powerful CPU cooler that fits into ViCase-Mini / ViCase-Ultra. 5 heat-pipes and a fan with 120 mm Ø provide cooling of even an i7 Quad Core without thermal cycling at the rated 88W TDP. In normal operation the fan speed can be reduced to 900 RPM and is inaudible for all intents and purposes.

Advice.heading: None
Advice.content: Choose None if you already have a cooler or if you want to use the boxed cooler that comes with the CPU. Please note that the boxed cooler will be louder at same thermal cooling capacity than ViCase-Cooler-M for ViCase-Tiny or ViCase-Cooler-L or ViCase-Cooler-XL for Mini.

yourChoice.name: ViCase Parallel
yourChoice.tag: Add Parallel Port for CNC Machine or old Printer

Advice.heading: When to use ( CNC )
Advice.content: Use ViCase-Parallel to add a Parallel Port to ViCase-Mini or ViCase-Ultra to connect to devices that need a parallel port and they depend on proper timing of the signals. The most common example would be the use in combination with the CNC controller MACH3, MACH4 or LinuxCNC. We used ViCase-Parallel in ViCase to control our CNC machine that made the prototype housings for ViCase and ViDock.

Advice.heading: When not to use
Advice.content: If you have on old style printer, then use a USB to Parallel Port Cable. They work great. You can buy them local and they cost less. And they do not block your PCIe Port.

Advice.heading: ViCase Modular All-In-One
Advice.content: ViCase offers you three methods to convert your ViCase Mini Computer into an All-In-One Computer using a regular Display. We call this new concept All-Form-Factor, because you get to keep the best of the three stationary Form Factors: 1) High Performance and Upgradeability of the Desktop, 2) Small size of the Mini and 3) Good looks and space savings of the All-In-One. Find more details on each of the 3 methods below:

Advice.heading: ViCase-VESA
Advice.content: The default choice to build an All-In-One computer with ViCase. For only $3 US you can hang your ViCase behind your Display. For more details, check the Gallery and Data Sheet..

Advice.heading: ViCase-Stand
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Stand to build a Luxury All-In-One Computer. It is CNC carved from 6 mm solid Aluminum. Sandblasted and anodized to match your ViCase. Your Display gains height and angle adjustment. If you need more space on your desk ViCase-Stand can park your keyboard. And a carry grip makes it easy to bring your ViCase All-In-One computer. Now it is comfortable to attend a LAN Party or work in the garden. For more details, check the Gallery and Data Sheet.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Feet
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Feet if you want the appearance of an All-In-One Computer, but your Display has no VESA mount. Simply place ViCase into ViCase-Stand and place it behind your Display. For more details, check the Gallery and Data Sheet.

Advice.heading: None
Advice.content: Choose None if you want to place your ViCase flat on the table.

yourChoice.tag: Remote Access of Power Button, USB2 port, USB3 port and Status LED

Advice.heading: ViCase-Access
Advice.content: Choose ViCase-Access if you placed your ViCase out of sight (e.g. behind your Display) yet you wish easy access to Status LEDs, Power Button and USB ports. Compatible to ViCase-Mini and ViCase-Ultra.

Advice.heading: ViCase-Access-Plus
Advice.content: Same function as ViCase-Access with the step up features: a) Housing made of Aluminum, sandblasted and anodized to match ViCase. b) One port is USB3. c) Compatible to all ViCase Models including ViCase-Tiny.

Advice.heading: None
Advice.content: Choose None if you place ViCase beside or under your Display, as you can easily access it's power switch or USB ports. You also have an option to get away without ViCase-Access when mounting ViCase behind your Display: You can mount ViCase so that the rear panel is facing up. Then it is easy to access the power switch and IO Ports when leaning over the top of the display. This works well if the display is placed in front of the wall, as in this mounting option the cable management is not so beautiful as with ViCase Rear panel facing down.

yourChoice.name: ViCase-Remote
yourChoice.tag: Control ViCase from the distance, just like a TV or Stereo

Advice.heading: You deserve to be lazy sometimes
Advice.content: If you never used a remote with your PC you are in for a treat. Listen to your Music with a headset on your couch and adjust volume or skip to the next song without getting up. Works equally as well to control your media player, such as VLC or cohorts. Works with Windows and Linux. Additional to Media Control, you get Mouse Control and Power On / Off and a set of function keys as you can see in the Gallery.

Gallery.title: ViCase-Remote►Size
Gallery.description: We like its size. Not too small to be hard to use and not too big to be hard to store.

Gallery.description: You can use the Remote without looking.

Gallery.title: ViCase-Remote►Tough

Advice.heading: V²P.12V-48W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.12V-48W if you are using AMD Entry Level CPU

Advice.heading: V²P.12V-120W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.12V-120W if you are using an Intel CPU not bigger than 65W TDP and no GPU

Advice.heading: V²P.12V-240W-Center
Advice.content: Choose V²P.12V-240W-Center if you are using a very powerful CPU over 65W TDP and / or a GPU PCIe Add In Card. Another reason to choose this option is safety and convenience. The integrated Surge Protection keeps your ViCase and Displays safe. The integrated power distribution cleans up the cable mess.

Advice.heading: 12V/48W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/48W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 48W AC/DC Adapter and you want to use AMD Entry Level, e.g. any ViDock G3 or higher AC/DC Adapter will work. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring.

Advice.heading: 12V/75W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/75W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 75W AC/DC Adapter, e.g. from a ViDock G3 or higher. 75W is powerful enough for AMD Entry Level or Intel 35W TDP CPU. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring.

Advice.heading: 12V/120W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/120W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 120W AC/DC Adapter, e.g. from a ViDock G3 or higher. 120W is powerful enough for Intel CPUs up to 65W TDP. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring.

Advice.heading: 12V/150W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/150W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 150W AC/DC Adapter, e.g. from a ViDock G3 or higher. 150W is powerful enough for Intel CPUs up to 88W TDP or for the combination 35W CPU + GPU. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring. Also make sure it has a Twin-DC Jack. This much power over a single DC Jack is a fire hazard. All Village Tronic 150W AC/DC Adapter have Twin DC Jacks.

Advice.heading: 12V/200W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/200W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 200W AC/DC Adapter, e.g. from a ViDock G3 or higher. 200W is powerful enough for Intel CPUs up to 88W TDP or for the combination 88W CPU + GPU. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring. Also make sure it has a Twin-DC Jack. This much power over a single DC Jack is a fire hazard. All Village Tronic 200W AC/DC Adapter have Twin DC Jacks.

yourChoice.name: V²P.pATX-200W
yourChoice.tag: 12V DC Input to ATX Power Supply. 200W. Very small!

Advice.heading: How to squeeze ATX Power into a Mini Computer
Advice.content: ViCase fits Mini-ITX Desktop Mother Boards, which in turn fit Desktop ATX Power Supplies. Trouble is, these power supplies are big. Heck, even the ATX cables are so big. The ATX cables alone fill the ViCase housing leaving no space for anything else. The solution are Pico ATX Power Supplies. The power supply itself is made tiny by using modern, high efficiency, high density (read expensive) power circuits. And the space consuming cables are done away completely, by soldering the power supply PCB directly to the ATX connector. Problem solved. Unfortunately you now need two Power Supplies: 1) AC/DC Adapter 2) Pico ATX Power aka ViCase-Power. This makes the power supply of the Mini Computer more expensive versus a standard Desktop. In turn you get a much smaller and much more quiet PC.

Advice.heading: V²P.pATX-120W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.pATX-120W for CPUs up to 65W TDP and no GPU. Please note that SATA Power Distribution is handled by ViCase. See its data sheet for more details.

Advice.heading: V²P.pATX-200W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.pATX-200W if you want to use a GPU or a CPU with more power than 65W TDP. Please note that SATA Power Distribution is handled by ViCase. See its data sheet for more details.

Advice.heading: None
Advice.content: Short answer: If you buy a ViCase, you must buy a ViCase-Power. Long answer: Sadly, Pico Power Supplies are not standardized yet. We will contribute such a (missing) standard as part of our V² Open Standard initiative to provide you (in the long run) with the option to buy your Pico Power Supply freely with choices from many vendors. Until then, you will need to buy a ViCase-Power with us, because it is custom made to fit the ViCase and its IO Panel.

yourChoice.name: V²P.μATX-200W
yourChoice.tag: Provide Power to ViCase from ViDock GPU

Advice.heading: How does it work
Advice.content: ATX power supplies are designed to power the PC Mainboard and the PCIe Add In GPU Card. ViDock GPU contains a regular ATX power supply to power its PCIe Add In GPU Card. V²P.μATX-200W is a kit of PCBs and cables that connects the power of the ATX power supply inside ViDock GPU to the Mini-ITX Mainboard in ViCase. On the plus side this method provides significant cost savings over using V²P.pATX-200W + V²P.12V-240W-Center. On the downside you only can use your ViCase with ViDock.

Advice.heading: When not to use V²P.μATX-200W
Advice.content: If you want to be able to use your ViCase without ViDock you need an independent power supply, such as V²P.pATX-200W + V²P.12V-240W-Center. Reasons could be that you want to share ViDock GPU with other PCs or that you want to build a portable All-In-One PC.

Advice.heading: When to use V²P.μATX-200W
Advice.content: If you always want to use your PC with ViDock connected than use V²P.μATX-200W. It provides significant cost savings! In this configuration the ATX power supply works exactly like in a regular Desktop PC, despite that you are using two housings instead of one. That said, each housing is designed with an optimized airflow, providing better cooling at a lower noise level when compared to the standard single Desktop housing.

yourChoice.name: ViDock-GPU-Cheapo

Advice.heading: Why to choose a ViDock
Advice.content: Short answer: A ViDock is a Modular PCIe Expansion Box. You can connect PCIe Add In Card to computers that otherwise could not. A specialized PCIe card could accelerate your application > 1000% when compared to your CPU. This makes adding a PCIe Card the most efficient method to speed up your PC. Dedicated PCIe cards can be expensive. This brings us to the second use case of ViDock: Share expensive cards with more than one PC.

Advice.heading: When not to choose a ViDock
Advice.content: ViCase Mini and ViCase Tiny come with a Low Profile PCIe Slot with double bracket being supported. A lot of PCIe Add In Cards are available in Low Profile. In such case inserting a PCIe Card into ViCase instead of ViDock is lower cost.

Advice.heading: ViDock-PCIe-S
Advice.content: Choose ViDock-PCIe-S if you want to connect a Full Profile PCIe Add In Card to your ViCase or any other compatible PC. All PCIe cards are supported, as long as all dimensions match PCIe Specs and the PCIe card is shorter than 240 mm / 9.5". No PCIe Aux power is supported. If you are using ViCase-Mini or ViCase-Tiny try to find the PCIe Card in Low Profile, then you do not need the ViDock.

Advice.heading: ViDock-PCIe-L
Advice.content: Choose ViDock-PCIe-L if your PCIe card is longer than 9.5". Otherwise ViDock-PCIe-L has same features as ViDock-PCIe-S.

Advice.heading: ViDock-GPU
Advice.content: Choose ViDock-GPU for GPU cards that need PCIe Aux Power. The ViDock-GPU case is much larger than the ViDock-PCIe Case in order to support GPU cards with over sized coolers. You will provide the ATX Power Supply. Make sure the power requirements of your GPU matches that of your ATX Power Supply. The case is made of high quality Aluminum. CNC carved, sand blasted and anodized.

Advice.heading: ViDock-GPU-Cheapo
Advice.content: Choose ViDock-GPU-Cheapo, if you want all the goodness of ViDock-GPU, yet you want to save money. The Case of ViDock-GPU-Cheapo is made of industrial sandwich plastic. It does not look great, but it works. The material is similar to wood. Ideal if you plan to make modifications to the housing. ViDock-GPU-Cheapo is ideal of you are on a budget, if you want to hack your ViDock or if you want to build a GPU farm with many GPUs connected to one PC.

Advice.heading: V²A.Nano
Advice.content: V²A.Nano is the default choice to connect your ViDock G6 with your PC. It is lower cost than V²A.Card and has 400% more PCIe Bandwidth. Compatible with all ViCase Models and Desktop PCs with x4 PCIe Slot.

Advice.heading: V²A.Card
Advice.content: Choose V²A.Card if you want to connect an older Generation ViDock (G1 ... G5) or if your PC has only a x1 PCIe Slot. Compatible with ViCase Mini and ViCase Ultra and Desktop PCs with x1 PCIe Slot.

yourChoice.name: V²C.Card
yourChoice.tag: x1 PCIe cable. Connects ViDock G6 to PC with ExpressCard Port

Advice.heading: Your benefit to use V² (TM) Cables
Advice.content: Today there is no standard connector to connect a PCIe Expansion Box or Docking Station to your PC. This puts you at the risk that by the time you buy a new computer, it will have another connector and you are forced to buy a new PCIe Expansion Box as well. Instead all V² cables have one standardized V²C.Micro connector, compatible with all V² Expansion products, such as ViDock. Using the different V²Cables and V² Adapters you can connect to: PCI Express (TM), Mini PCI Express (TM), ExpressCard (TM), Thunderbolt (TM), V²C.Nano (TM), V²C.Mini (TM), V²C.Card (TM). Support for more connections such as WiGig is in development. This means if your next computer has a different connector, all you need to do is to buy a different V² Cable or Adapter and you can keep your PCIe Expansion Box / Docking Station.

Advice.heading: V²C.Nano
Advice.content: The default choice of cable to connect your ViDock G6 to your PC with V²A.Nano port. V²C.Nano is the latest V²C Technology with a fast x4 PCIe connection.

Advice.heading: V²C.Mini
Advice.content: Choose V²C.Mini to connect ViDock G6 to your Mini Computer, All-In-One PC or Low Cost Desktop PC that have a mPCIe aka Mini PCI Express bay. This is a semi permanent connection, as such it does not work for Notebooks. mPCIe is an older PCIe connector with a x1 connection. It will be sufficient for most GPU application when paired with an nVidia GTX card or for Audio DSP cards or RAID for up to 5 drives.

Advice.heading: V²C.Card
Advice.content: Choose V²C.Card to connect ViDock G6 to your Notebook with an ExpressCard Slot, or if your PC only has a x1 PCIe Slot and you use V²A.Card. ExpressCard is an older PCIe connector with a x1 connection. It will be sufficient for most GPU application when paired with an nVidia GTX card or for Audio DSP cards or RAID for up to 5 drives.

Advice.heading: How to connect Thunderbolt?
Advice.content: Sonnet Technologies offer a Thunderbolt to ExpressCard Adapter by the name of Sonnet Echo ExpressCard. It is available world wide. It works with V²C.Card. When we reach the Stretch Goal of the ViDock Campaign we will launch another campaign for a low cost Thunderbolt Adapter.

Advice.content: V², V²A, V²B, V²C, V²D, V²E, V²P are Trademarks of the V² Movement. Advice.heading: V²P.12V-48W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.12V-48W if you are using x1 or x4 PCIe cards in your ViDock. Or if you have a x8 or x16 PCIe card, which datasheet states a less than 48W power consumption

Advice.heading: V²P.12V-120W
Advice.content: Choose V²P.12V-120W if you are using a x16 PCIe card that needs more than 48W. E.g. a GPU card.

Advice.heading: 12V/48W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/48W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 48W AC/DC Adapter e.g. any ViDock G3 or higher AC/DC Adapter will work. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring.

Advice.heading: 12V/120W-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose 12V/120W-Already-Owned if you already own a 12V / 120W AC/DC Adapter, e.g. from a ViDock G3 or higher. If you own the 150W or 200W ViDock Adapter, they will work too. 120W is powerful enough for GPU cards that do not require an additional PCIe Aux Power cable. In case you use a 3rd Party Adapter, make sure it has a 5.5 / 2.5 mm Ø DC Jack and Minus is on the outside Ring.

Advice.heading: ATX-PSU-650W-EVGA-Gold
Advice.content: The selected EVGA SuperNOVA 650 G1 80+ GOLD, 650W ATX Power Supply is of very high quality. The EVGA even gives 10 year warranty. It is very quiet. Thanks to its modular cable design you will have very clean wiring inside your ViDock. This power supply is strong enough to also power ViCase in all possible configurations, if you choose to use the V²P.μATX Power option.

Advice.heading: ATX-PSU-Already-Owned
Advice.content: Choose this option if you already own an ATX Power Supply. Make sure its power ratings is up to what your GPU is drawing.

Advice.heading: Who Board Products are for
Advice.content: You want to develop your own PCIe Expansion Product(s). By choosing the V² PCIe Expansion System, you get ready made: 1) Host Port Support for: PCIe-Slot, mPCIe Slot, ExpressCard, V²C.Card, V²C.Nano, Thunderbolt 2) PCIe Expansion Mother Board 3) PCIe Expansion IO Board 4) PCIe Cables. 5) Box Control Interface. 6) Micro Controller Programming

Advice.heading: V²B.Mobo-1
Advice.content: Choose V²B.Mobo-1 if you want to build PCIe Expansion Products with a x1, x2 or x4 PCIe cable connection supporting all PCIe Cards up to x16. You have three choices for your IO Board: 1) IO-1 to connect to DC 12V Power, IO-2 to connect to ATX Power Supply 3) Build your own IO Board. The IO Board is a simple design, requiring only 2 Layers. We will publish an Open Source Development Kit for the V²B.IO-2 by the time V²B.Mobo-1 ships. Availability of the V²B.IO-2 in Open Source will NOT depend on any Stretch Goal.

Advice.heading: V²B.IO-1
Advice.content: Choose V²B.IO-1 if you want to connect your PCIe Expansion to 12V DC Power

Advice.heading: V²B.IO-2
Advice.content: Choose V²B.IO-2 if you want to connect your PCIe Expansion to a standard PC ATX Power Supply with ATX-24P connector

Advice.heading: V²B.Mobo-1 + V²B.IO-1
Advice.content: Choose both PCBs if you want to build a product similar to ViDock-PCIe.

Advice.heading: V²B.Mobo-1 + V²B.IO-2
Advice.content: Choose both PCBs if you want to build a product similar to ViDock-GPU.

table.title: x4 Open PCIe Slot
row: Regular PCIe Slot, same as found in a desktop. It is open to the rear, thus mechanically all PCIe Card will fit including x8 and x16. Electrically all PCIe Cards that follow PCIe Spec should work. Electrical connection width is x4 PCIe.

data.name: Motherboard
TableTag: (1) All Motherboard IO is integrated into AM1 CPU. Thus no MoBo Chip needed.
(2) AM1 CPU have by far lowest cost and power consumption. But maximum performance is limited to about same performance as a high end tablet.
(3) All current intel Desktop CPU use this socket from entry level to high end, except the very latest ones
(4) Brand new CPU socket, just released in second half of 2015
(5) Accelerate your HD with your SSD (very useful)
(6) The mPCIe socket is occupied with included WLan module

(7) 1080p = 1920 x 1080. UHD Is one form of 4K Display resolution of 3940x2160 pixels size. This is the common format of 4K displays. There is a slightly bigger one used in Cinema. The ASRock Z170-ITX/ac can drive that one too!

yourChoice.name: Entry Motherboard
yourChoice.tag: MSI-AM1

yourChoice.name: Mid Motherboard
yourChoice.tag: ASRock-H81M-ITX

yourChoice.name: High Motherboard
yourChoice.tag: ASRock-Z170-ITX/ac

Advice.heading: Entry Level Motherboard
Advice.content: Choose this motherboard if lowest power consumption and / or lowest cost is most important. You have CPU choices of 12 and 25W. The lowest Intel CPU choice is 35 W. But since the Motherboard chip is integrated in AMD AM1 and not integrated in Intel CPUs your power consumption comparison is 12 W versus 48W. Keep in mind though that maximum performance of Entry AMD line is limited to about the performance level of a tablet. In some countries Entry AMD is half the cost for motherboard and CPU when compared to Entry Intel. In other countries the cost is the same. This motherboard directly supports UHD = 4k Display. Only at 30 Hz, but will be sufficient for high end picture frame. Paired with ViCase Tiny you get a Mini or All-In-One PC of lowest cost, lowest power consumption with good looks. Using standard Desktop components will allow you to upgrade only parts when needed and keep it operational for decades to come. The very low power consumption allows for passive cooling and makes this PC practically maintenance free.

Advice.heading: Mid Range Motherboard
Advice.content: Lowest cost Intel Motherboard. Comes with all basic features to build a mid range PC with a fast SSD Boot Disk and if needed a second Data Disk for more space @ better cost. Great foundation for a mid range PC, including decent gaming when paired with a GPU. The LGA 1150 CPU socket supports a huge range of intel CPU up to the very fast i7 Quad Core 4790. This means you will have plenty of room to upgrade your CPU later if so desired. You can build computer with this motherboard that will be snappy at everything you throw at them, except for high end demanding applications.

Advice.heading: High End Motherboard
Advice.content: Choose this board if you are looking for ultimate performance. Lets break it down into sections: 1) Disks: Very high performing RAID 5 Controller. We use this in the high end configurations to give you very large Data Disks at speed levels similar to SSD and security even beyond. 2) NVME-M2: This port is 600% faster than SATA 3. A dramatic improvement. 3) 32 GB DDR4. You can use more memory and it is 40% faster than DDR3. 4) New CPU Socket 1151: It gives you all these cool features and makes your board future proof. 5) Integrated 4K Display support: Connect the latest 4K display without the need to add a GPU card. 6) Build in WiFi. 7) If you are looking for the fastest PC possible, choose this board with confidence. ViCase comes with the matching CPU cooling solution, so you can run even the biggest CPU at 100% load all the time without thermal throttling. The V²Configurator has high end configurations to turn all these extras into a much faster computer for you.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the Motherboard

yourChoice.tag: Intel - i7-6700K

Advice.heading: Sempron 2650
Advice.content: Choose this CPU if you are looking for the lowest cost or for the lowest power consumption. You can even turn off one of the two cores and the whole system will use 6W only at full load. Ideal for a general purpose low cost PC or for a presentation PC, such as a large size 28" picture frame to replace an A2 printer or presentation displays in meeting rooms, lobby, hotels, etc. The very low power consumption allows the use of a passive cooler, which makes this PC completely maintenance free and literally silent when paired with an SSD. Performance will feel like a decent tablet. Recommended OS Ubuntu. It also may serve as a streaming PC for Gaming or Video. Be aware that in some countries an Intel Celeron CPU is lower cost and at the same time faster.

Advice.heading: Athlon 5350
Advice.content: This is the speed upgrade for the Entry Level System. It is 3 x faster than the Sempron-2650 and almost as fast as the Pentium-G3250. This CPU will give you a very snappy Office / General Purpose PC. The power budget is still very small with 25W in total, which leads to additional savings in power supply and CPU cooler. Bear in mind that this is the fastest CPU that you can plug into the Entry Motherboard. If you plan on growing the performance of your PC, then you will be better served with the Mid Range Motherboard. But if you are looking for lowest cost, low power consumption HTPC / Office PC, this is the best value — with quite a margin.

Advice.heading: i3-4160
Advice.content: The i3 is about twice the speed than the Athlon 5350. Also GPU performance is another mark up. Now you can play games such as Minecraft or work with more demanding Apps. E.g. most Video Editing up to 1080p will be fine. E.g. we edited our Indiegogo Pitch Video on this CPU w/o GPU. This CPU uses the same LGA 1150 socket. This means you can replace this CPU at a later time even with an i5 or i7 Quad Core. Enough room to grow. Pairing the i3 with the GTX-750 will be your entry ticket to the world of high end gaming.

Advice.heading: i5-4570S
Advice.content: This is another mark up. Besides faster CPU score via Quad Core also get Hyper-V, ideal if you plan to run virtual machines. This CPU is also powerful enough to drive bigger GPU cards that GTX 750, such as the GTX 970.

Advice.heading: i5-6500
Advice.content: This is the latest generation of Quad Core CPU. Choose this CPU for High End Gaming, Video Editing, Audio Editing, Photo Editing, 3D Design or other very demanding applications. Instead of going all the way to an i7 Quad Core you often get higher performance for your money by investing into a PCIe Add In Card of the type corresponding to your application. The i5-6500 CPU comes with the newly released LGA 1151 socket with the key benefit to support DDR4. DDR4 memory clock starts today at 2133 MHz, versus 1600 MHz of DDR3. Yet you will not see today faster memory transfer rates in real life. This is because the CAS timing is more relaxed as with DDR3 memory. Surely this will change in the future. However, there is one benefit that you can enjoy instantly. DDR4 will allow in an ITX motherboard 32 GB, whereas DDR3 will max out at 16 GB!

Advice.heading: i7-6700K
Advice.content: Choose this CPU if you are looking for the Ultimate in CPU performance.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the right CPU

Advice.heading: Avoid collision of Memory Module with CPU Cooler
Advice.content: Memory Modules come with Low Profile and High Profile. Low Profile will work with ViCase-Cooler-L. High Profile Modules may collide with the Cooler-L, depending on your Motherboard layout. As always, if you do not want to be troubled with such details, use the Wizard of the V²Configurator. All our ready made configurations using High Profile Memory Modules use the ViCase-Cooler-XL to ensure conflict free assembly for you. Its more expensive design based on heat pipes allows for larger memory modules. To make life simple, all DDR3 memory modules we selected are Low Profile and all DDR4 Modules are High Profile. This makes for straight forward paring: DDR3 with ViCase-Cooler-L and DDR4 with ViCase-Cooler-XL.

Advice.heading: Always use two Memory Modules
Advice.content: Each Memory Module is 64 Bit. Today's CPUs have a 128 Bit memory connection. For this reason two Memory Modules will give you twice the memory speed than only one module. In other words when choosing memory for your Motherboard, always use two modules of the same kind to benefit from double speed. This is called Dual-channel memory architecture. All our ready made configurations use two Memory Modules, except for the lowest entry level configuration where lower cost was more important than speed.

Advice.heading: Memory for Entry Level
Advice.content: Choose a single Memory Module of 2 GB DDR3 for Entry Level systems if cost is paramount. For $14 more you get 4 GB and twice the memory bandwidth, which is good value for money. Choose 1600 MHz over 1333, because it is faster and when shopping carefully you can find the 1600 MHz for the same price.

Advice.heading: Memory for Mid Range
Advice.content: Choose 4 GB DDR3 in 2 x 2GB Modules @ 1600 MHz if you run standard applications. If you run virtual machines, go for 8 GB. More memory is always better, but there is also hitting the ceiling with very diminished returns on your investment. If in doubt, check respective forums of your app and ask around how much memory they are using.

Advice.heading: Memory for High End
Advice.content: Choose 8 GB DDR4 in 2 x 4GB Modules @ 2133 MHz when you run most demanding Apps. Also consult with the documentation of your App, they may recommend more. More memory is always better, but there is also hitting the ceiling with very diminished returns on your investment. If in doubt, check respective forums of your app and ask around how much memory they are using. If you are running demanding apps in virtual machines you may want to start with 16 GB.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the right DRAM

TableBody.title: Max Mem Size in ITX MoBo

TableTag: (1) Memory Modules come with Low Profile and High Profile. Since we use DDR3 in cost sensitive Entry and Mid Range configurations and DDR4 in performance demanding High End Builds, we chose all DDR3 modules to be Low Profile and all DDR4 Modules to be High Profile
(2) ViCase-Cooler-L is a very cost efficient design without heat pipes. It does not allow space for High Profile Memory Modules.
(3) ViCase-Cooler-XL uses 5 heat pipes. This not only makes it a very powerful CPU cooler, but the design also made space for High Profile Memory modules.

Gallery.title: Single Low Profile DDR3 Module
Gallery.description: A single module is half speed versus two modules. Only use a single Module when you are in the tightest of budgets. Smallest size available is 2 GB.

Gallery.title: Twin Low Profile DDR3 Module
Gallery.description: The standard configuration for most computer. Smallest size available for Mini-ITX is 4 GB (2x2GB), the largest size is 16 GB.

Gallery.title: Twin Low Profile DDR4 Module
Gallery.description: The mechanical difference is the key is to the right side off center. Smallest size is 8 GB via 2 x 4 GB Modules. A heat spreader will increase life expectancy.

Gallery.title: Twin High Profile DDR4 Module
Gallery.description: Higher profile provides more PCB space for memory chips and more space for the heat sink. Higher profile may not be compatible with ViCase-Cooler-L, but the ViCase-Cooler-XL will always be compatible.

Advice.heading: SSD vs HDD for Boot Disk
Advice.content: In terms of speeding up a PC, nothing beats value for money over using an SSD. As such all our Ready Made Configuration use SSD as Boot Disk. At small sizes SSD are even lower cost than HDD. For $50 US you can get a 120 GB SSD. Enough space for boot disk and and work data. If however you want to store large amounts of data, say photos, videos, etc..., then we recommend your Data to be stored on a second HDD for cost reasons. Using RAID 5 technology, you can make HDD quite save and fast. More about that in the Article How to choose your Data Disk

Advice.heading: Why a fast Boot-Disk is so important?
Advice.content: 1.The responsiveness of your computer depends on the responsiveness of the disk which your Operating Systems uses to boot. Faster Boot Disk will make your PC feel to you much faster.

2.Installer defaults will assume that your Boot-Disk is the fastest disk in your system and will put caches on the Boot-Disk. If your Boot-Disk is not the fastest disk, by default your Apps will run slower.

Advice.heading: Entry Level and Mid Range
Advice.content: Choose SATA 3 SSD for Entry Level and Mid Range PC configurations. They are low cost, fast, easy top install and compatible to all OS and Motherboards. If you are upgrading from a PC with an HDD you are in for a treat. Even the entry level SSD nowadays is 10 x faster the the best Desktop HDD from yesteryear.

Advice.heading: High End
Advice.content: You have two choices for higher performance of SATA3 SSD: 1) RAID 0 of two SATA3 SSD. This will double the speed and capacity. Alternatively choose NVME M.2. For twice the cost you get about 300 ... 400% speed increase over SSD or 150 ... 200% of speed over RAID0 SSD. Bear in mind that this only works well with latest high end motherboards and latest OS and requires extra care during installation. When the time comes we will provide a How-To Video on YouTube.

Advice.heading: High Performance Server
Advice.content: Consumer M.2 modules overheat when loaded with the workload of a server and they also do not support that kind of workload. This is where the 750 Series from Intel fits in. In terms of IO Operations even faster than NVME M.2 modules and designed for the heavy load in a Server. In case you want to build a system with even more reliability, you can choose SSD RAID 1 for a redundant boot disk and choose the NVME-PCIe as Data Disk.

Advice.heading: Recommendations on capacities
Advice.content: For a regular PC running Windows 10 or Ubuntu and a bunch of Apps 120 GB will be fine. If your budget is not too tight for $50 US more you get 250 GB and have some room to grow. If you store a lot of Photos / Movies / Songs you will need more space. However, for these data a slower HDD will do in most cases and gives you more space for your money. For more information → Data Disk.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the Boot Disk

Advice.heading: 2.5" for home use
Advice.content: 2.5" are more quiet and use less power. Capacities of up to 1 TB are sufficient for most home use.

Advice.heading: Red for higher reliability
Advice.content: Western Digital Red are disks for NAS and RAID. They are significantly more reliable than standard disks. They only cost a small premium and they last much longer. They are available in 2.5" and 3.5". We only use WD Red in our own PCs, even in single HDD configurations.

Advice.heading: 3.5" on capacities > 1 TB
Advice.content: If you need to store more than 1 TB of data, then it is time to switch to 3.5". Nothing beats 3.5" HDD when storing large amount of data at low cost. ViCase Ultra has space for 3 disks 3.5". In addition it has a special airflow design to keep your disks cool. To offset the higher noise of 3.5" disks the ViCase Ultra has a HDD silencer. These features make ViCase Ultra more expensive, but you save the money with the lower cots per TB on 3.5" disks. Please note that you can place ViCase Ultra behind your Display and out of sight. As such the larger size is not relevant, as you would not see it anyways.

Advice.heading: NAS and Enterprise Class for higher reliability
Advice.content: NAS Disks are dramatically more reliable than Consumer Disks. Western Digital has the Red Product Family. They work equally as well when used as a single drive or when used in a RAID. Consumer disks are build for a workload of about 2 hours per day, whereas RED is build and guaranteed for a workload of 24/7. If you use your computer longer than 2 hours / day, be sure to use Red. And if you want even better reliability, enterprise class disks have even higher reliability. For more information, please see the next chapter → Data Disk (RAID)

Advice.heading: Consider RAID for large Data Storage
Advice.content: When you need larger capacities you may want to consider RAID5. A 3 Disk RAID 5 system will double the transfer speed of your HDD and it will make your data more safe. Even if one disk fails completely you still have all your data due to the redundancy of RAID5. For more information see the next Chapter → Data Disk (RAID)

Advice.heading: NVME-PCIe Intel 750
Advice.content: The ideal Disk for High Performance High Workload Database or Web Server. Two options of 400 and 800 GB. Used in high reliability Server configuration that boots from two SATA SSD in RAID 1. For more information, please see the previous Section: "Boot Disk".
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the Data Disks

Advice.heading: Why RAID 5 is cool
Advice.content: A 3 Disk RAID5 is twice as fast than a single disk. Ideal for demanding applications. And your data is much safer. Hard drives do fail. If you have a RAID 5 system you do not need to worry about it. Even if a hard disk fails, you can continue working. No data has been lost due to the redundancy. Swap out the bad drive with a good one and you are safe again.

Advice.heading: RAID features of ViCase Ultra
Advice.content: ViCase Ultra is designed from ground up for 3.5" RAID. The RAID drives are placed in a dedicated stream of cold air. We use an ultra low noise 80 mm fan, which is thermal regulated by the drive temperature. The drives itself are placed within a sound silencer. Now you can enjoy the speed and safety of RAID 5 without the problems of hot drives or a loud work computer.

Advice.heading: Red, the ideal RAID drive
Advice.content: Western Digital Red has become the standard drives for NAS / RAID configurations. They are designed to operate 24/7, they run relatively cool and quiet and still have descent performance. We have put Western Digital Blue as an example for a typical consumer desktop drive and you can see in several critical features it is not up to the task of a RAID drive.

Advice.heading: Re, the high performance, ultra reliable
Advice.content: The Re drives are faster and even more reliable. Consequently they are also more expensive. Due to higher speed they also run more loud and more hot. This disadvantage is mostly mitigated when used in ViCase Ultra → RAID features of ViCase Ultra

Advice.heading: Do NOT use desktop drives in RAID
Advice.content: Desktop drives are build for a workload of about 2 hours per day. Who uses RAID uses their disks in general at least 9 hours / day. Desktop drives simply will fail to early, as they are not build for long working hours. Another difference is that desktop drives are designed to be the only disk in a case. The difference is vibration, which will significantly shorten the lifespan of a Disk. RAID drives are designed to higher specs to avoid vibration in the first place and higher class RAID drives even have active vibration cancellation. Also desktop may be recognized as bad even when they are still good when used in a RAID due to different time out standards of desktop drives versus RAID drives. In shorty. do NOT use desktop drives in a RAID. If you are on budget, Western Digital RED are about the same cost as quality desktop drives and they work beautifully in RAID.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the Data Disks

TableTag: (1) Extremely tight tolerances reduce vibration and thus increase life span of drive. Western Digital calls this: 3D Active Balance Plus

(2) RAFF is short for Rotary Acceleration Feed Forward and means that multiple axis accelerator sense vibration and a dedicated electronic create active vibration cancellation, to compensate for vibration caused by fans or other drives. This technology is very effective and one reason for the extended life span / reliability of the Re drives.

(3) A RAID controller requires a time out of under 7 seconds to avoid that a good drive is accidentally marked as bad one. One of many reasons not to use consumer drives such as WD Green in RAID configurations.

Advice.heading: 32 / 64 Bit
Advice.content: If your PC has less than 3 GB choose 32 Bit, if more than 3 GB choose 64 Bit. We only have one 2 GB configuration for the absolute lowest cost PC.

Advice.heading: Windows or Linux
Advice.content: It depends on which Applications you want to run. If all your Apps are available on Linux, then choose Linux due to its lower cost. Windows also still has the edge for graphics card driver support or support for very special hardware. In terms of usability both are close and fun to use.

Advice.heading: Windows OEM or Windows Full
Advice.content: You most likely want the OEM Edition, due to its lower cost. You qualify as you build your PC yourself. The license includes that you can continuously upgrade your PC, this includes changing of Motherboard & CPU as well as hard disk. The OEM Version is the same product but without support. In our experience we could solve all our support problems by researching the web for solutions. Your mileage may vary.

Advice.heading: Windows Home or Business
Advice.content: In general you will want Home Edition for home use and Business Edition for business use. To save cost you always can use the Home Edition for business use. You need to check if you are OK with the features that you loose. →Microsoft►Which Windows is right for you

Advice.heading: Which version of Ubuntu
Advice.content: You will always want to choose between two versions: 1) The newest out there 2) The latest LTS. LTS stands for Long Term Support. For normal use this is sufficient, recommended and the most stable one. The latest version instead is of course the latest and greatest, including the latest bugs. Choose this Version if you are the more adventurous type or choose it to have better support for GPUs or other newest hardware. → Ubuntu►Wiki►Releases

Advice.heading: SteamOS
Advice.content: SteamOS will be a game changer. Pun intended. One day in the future GPUs under SteamOS will have same FPS than under Windows. And all Titles will be available under SteamOS too. Today - however - SteamOS is in beta. Only about 1/3 of game Titles are available for SteamOS. Frame rate might be noticeably slower than on Windows. It has one thing going for it that is the support of its cool game pad.
If you want more Advice on this topic, please check out the Article → V²►How to DIY Mini PC►How to choose the right OS

TableTag: (1) If you build a new PC you need to buy a new Windows OEM Version, but you can use the same OS if you bought the Full Edition. However, upgrading your PC with the OEM Edition is allowed.

Advice.heading: Importance of choosing the right GPU
Advice.content: If your Use case is Gaming or Creative Design then the GPU is possibly the most expensive part in your PC, because it has the biggest value for money to make your PC fast for your Use Case. We took great care in choosing 5 GPU models covering the range form entry level to High End and match them with a proper CPU, optimized for each budget slot.

Advice.heading: Is a Workstation GPU better for you?
Advice.content: If your Use Case is Creative Work you may want to check out the Workstation GPUs. They might suit your needs better than the Game GPUs. Please see the Section "Workstation GPUs" in the Configurator for more details.

Advice.heading: Low Profile fit in ViCase-Mini / ViCase-Ultra
Advice.content: Most of our recommended GPU cards are Low Profile. As such they fit directly into ViCase-Mini and ViCase-Ultra. Keeping your PC very tiny, belying their performance.

Advice.heading: Full Profile fit in ViDock GPU with optimized cooling
Advice.content: Only the three highest end GPUs, the GTX 960, 970 and 980 are Full Profile Cards. As such they need ViDock GPU to connect them to ViCase. Having a separate case for the GPU has the advantage of a much better airflow design, keeping all your PC parts cooler to prevent premature aging and at the same time keeping your PC more quiet versus a single case Desktop. ViCase + ViDock is a two case solution that is smaller, quieter, cooler and more modular versus a single case desktop.

Advice.heading: Choosing optimum CPU for GPU
Advice.content: If you want to over-ride the suggestions of the ready made configurations in the Wizard of the V²Configurator, then keep in mind to choose a CPU that matches the performance needs of your GPU. For more details, please refer to our comparison table.

Advice.heading: Guru 3D is a great GPU review resource
Advice.content: If you want to dig in and find the exact best GPU for you, then http://www.guru3d.comhttp://www.guru3d.com is a great place. They review pretty much every major GPU card and they do it in incredible detail.→  http://www.guru3d.com

Advice.heading: Cards with more than 4 GB Memory
Advice.content: If you use the GPU card for rendering, you may want a card with 6 or 8 GB. They are available and easy to find on  www.newegg.com and  www.amazon.com. Consult with your 3D Rendering application or ask in respective forums how much memory you need.

3DMark11 ... 2000: Average performance. Most games are playable on low or medium settings
3DMark11 ... 3000: Good performance. All games will run with recommended settings in HD resolutions
3DMark11 ... 5000+: Excellent Performance. Most games will run with max. Settings. Usually Good value for money
3DMark11 10,000+: Best of the best. Runs everything you throw at it on max settings. Powerful enough to drive 3 displays in HD for surround gaming

Advice.heading: Game or Workstation GPU
Advice.content: You get what is printed on the Box: Workstation GPUs come with driver for professional Apps, such as SolidWorks, Adobe Creative Cloud and cohorts. You can use Workstation GPUs for gaming, but if all you want to do is gaming , you may want to purchase a GeForce Graphics Card that will give you much more performance for games for your money.

Advice.heading: Hacking a Game GPU into a Workstation Card
Advice.content: There are hacks out there so that you can use a Game GPU as a Workstation GPU. We did that for us and it worked for us, but there are no guarantees and no support for choosing this path. This also requires additional time finding and trying different hacks. The safe and professional way is to use Workstation Cards for your professional Apps.

Advice.heading: K420
Advice.content: If you are on a budget, this is your entry ticket into Workstation Graphics for under $100.

Advice.heading: K620
Advice.content: This card is the default choice for Workstation. With 384 Cores and 2 GB of memory it is fast enough for most work.

Advice.heading: K1200
Advice.content: This is a high end card with 512 CUDA cores, 4 GB of very fast GDDR5 that will make your professional Apps fly. You also can drive 4 Displays and each Display can be 4K @ 60 Hz.

Advice.heading: Notes on complaints in reviews
Advice.content: All complaints we have seen were about the lack of Full Profile bracket. This is irrelevant when using ViCase. You only need the included Low Profile bracket.

Advice.heading: So much better than nothing
Advice.content: Having an external drive for backup is so much better than nothing. Hard drives fail. If you have no backup you will be buggered. An external drive is easiest solution and delivers a lot of safety for little money and effort. These drives are cheap and do not have high durability. As such disconnect them and power them off when not in use. For higher reliability use two drives. Alternate the backup. This way you still have a backup in case something went wrong in the last backup or one of the two drives got damaged or stolen.

Advice.heading: Choosing external drive over one drive cloud server
Advice.content: I could find no specs on what hard drive would be installed. As such there is no specs on MTBF, expected on time or any other reliability information. This does not bode well that a reliable drive will be inside. Consumer drives that are on all the time fail quite frequently, which is not a good idea for your backup drive. As such we do not recommend the one drive cloud servers, but rather an external drive that is disconnected and powered off when not in use. If you want the convenience of an always on server for backups, then consider a 4 Disk RAID5. It is not cheap, but dramatically more safe.

Advice.heading: Make backing up a habit
Advice.content: E.g. plug in and power on your drive and start the sequential backup software before you go to lunch. This way you will not forget it. A good schedule is to backup once a day and on the week end you swap the drive at another location. This way you are protected against two more troubles. One is that if one location gets damaged then your data is still safe in the alternate location. The other one is that one drive could go bad or you could make a mistake when backing up thus damaging the data.

TableTag: (1) Say you are on a weekly rotation cycle. In this case you still can recover your file on the second drive if the file is old enough to be backed up with last weeks backup.

Gallery.description: Your entry ticket to have backups. Up to 5 TB. Use two drives alternating per week stored in two locations for best safety.

Advice.heading: When your Data are important
Advice.content: A RAID5 NAS keeps your Data safe. Even when a hard disk fails, all is well. Swap out the bad drive and life goes on without any interruption or lost data. One step safer is to use a RAID5 system in your workstation -- such as ViCase-Ultra -- and make sequential backups on your NAS. And the highest level of safety is to have two NAS in two locations. So if one location is lost, be it by thief or higher force, then you still have your data safe in another location. A Synologyt NAS is very simple to setup. If your Data is important you should keep it safe. Life happens. Give yourself peace of mind.

Advice.heading: Why we recommend Synology
Advice.content: Synology has very easy to use software for setup and configuration. Virus protection is integrated. The documentation is very easy to find and understand. You easy to can see for yourself when you click the links in Data Sheets below.

Advice.heading: RAID5 with 4 or 8 Disks 3.5"
Advice.content: When you want to protect your Data, RAID5 is the only way to go. And due to cost and available storage size 3.5" is the only choice.

Advice.heading: WD Red
Advice.content: We recommend wholeheartedly WD Red for NAS. Re is overkill. You can not benefit from the speed, but you will have more problems as they get more hot. You already have RAID 5, so if a disk fails you can replace it without loss of data. For more information why WD Red for RAID and what they cost, see our Section: V²Configurator►6. PC Parts►Data Disk (RAID)

Advice.heading: Connect via USB3 or LAN?
Advice.content: LAN supports long distance but only 90 MB/s. USB3 is much faster with 450 MB/s but your cable can only be 5m long. Also see the next chapter if speed is important for you.

Advice.heading: How important is speed?
Advice.content: It depends on your use case. If you work on your data on the Server, then speed is very important. If your data are on your local drives and you use the NAS for backup, then speed is not important. Backups will be made sequential and in the background and you will feel no difference whether your NAS has a high or slow data transfer rate. In general it is recommended to work on your data locally and use the NAS for backup. This is the fastest and safest way of working.

Advice.heading: Free placement with cradle
Advice.content: Trouble free WiFi is all about good reception. At 2.4 and 5 GHz wireless reception is not equal in each spot. Moving around the Antenna while looking at the reception bar will allow you to find a spot with better reception and thus enjoy higher speed. We choose these two models because their design with cradle and cable allow you to place the Antenna freely, independent from where your PC happens to be.

Advice.heading: Single or Dual Band
Advice.content: Single Band means that data transfer happens on the 2.4 GHz Band. Dual Band can transfer data on two bands: 2.4 GHz and 5.0 GHz. If you are living in a not so densely populated space then Single Band should be fine. If however you life in an apartment of a high rise, it is possible that the Single Band is full and you will have speed issues. The higher band is not used as much as it is newer. Having two bands will increase chances for your router to find space for your transmission and as such you will have better chances on speed in with a Dual Band solution.

yourChoice.tag: Excellent 24" Display with VESA, IPS & Speaker (VN248H-P)

Advice.content: Choose 22" when you want a smaller display or when you are on a budget.
The default choice for Full HD resolution, aka 1080p aka 1920 x 1080.

Advice.heading: Should I go 4K ?
Advice.content: 4K Displays cost a significant premium. You get 400% more pixels for 400% more money. But your display size will increase only slightly from 24" to 28". This means your pixel density will increase a lot, which will be very beneficial if: 1) you work a lot with text and you want your text to look sharper 2) you work a lot with photos of at least 8 MP resolution 3) you edit / watch a lot of 4K movies.

Advice.heading: IPS
Advice.content: Choose IPS when other people with watch the Display with you at the same time. IPS is a new technology which increases the viewing angle without color shift. Meaning a person to the side sees the same thing as a person in front of the display. If you are the only user, you will most likely see no difference to the older and lower cost technology.

Advice.heading: Analog / D-Sub / VGA
Advice.content: Do not use this connection. It reduces image quality. Nowadays all displays and motherboards have digital connection. Use those for better image quality at the same cost

Advice.heading: HDMI, DVI, Display port
Advice.content: All are all digital connectors and all deliver a high quality image to the Display. With the proper cable you can convert one connector to another. Say your motherboard has a DVI connector and your Display has Display Port, then you still can make a connection using a DVI to Display Port cable.

Advice.heading: Build In Speaker
Advice.content: They are very convenient and significantly reduce the mess on your table. They become mandatory in case you want to use your Disply with ViCase-Stand in order to carry your All-In-One.

TableTag: (1) Yes means this display is compatible to ViCase-VESA, which is a $3 ViCase-Extra Accessory that converts your Display into an All-In-One by mounting ViCase to your Display.

(2) Yes means this Display is compatible to ViCase-Stand, which is a $49 luxury All-In-One Converter. It also gives you a keyboard shelf to store your keyboard when not in use or in transport and a carry grip to carry the entire unit of PC + Display + Power Supply + Keyboard.
(3) LED backlight delivers more even light, it has a longer lifespan and is more environmentally friendly versus the traditional fluorescent light

(4) IPS is a newer Display technology which allows wider viewing angles. If you frequently use your display with more than one person, it will show a significant difference. If you are the only user you might not see a difference.

(5) D-Sub connector is used for the old analog VGA connection. The image on the screen will not be as sharp as with digital connection and you might see other distortions. As such, try to avoid to use VGA / D-Sub connection.

(6) HDMI, DVI, Display port are all digital connectors and all deliver a high quality image to the Display. With the proper cable you can convert one connector to another. Say your motherboard has a DVI connector and your Display has Display Port, then you still can make a connection using a DVI to Display Port cable.
